artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Matsui Eikichi; Carver: Noguchi Enkatsu
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
dimension: 14 1/4 × 9 15/16 in. (36.2 × 25.24 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年 {Yoshitoshi} | Carver’s seal: 円活刀{Enkatsu tō}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper
text: Portrait of the actor Ichikawa Danjūrō IX (1838-1903) as Kusunoki Taitō Masatsura (1326-1348) being killed at the Battle of Shijōnawate near Nara in 1348.
title: Theater Reformation: Stories Gleaned at Yoshino, Picture of Kusunoki Masatsura Dying at the Battle of Shijōnawate
